Fields.Dialogue Text: and my body is aching... wait, where is my body?? I can't see it! I'm in a dream? what are these stars? Did I fell asleep in the Constellarium? but I don't remember going there...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: You are in the Ether, %PLAYERNAME. I warned you that if we continued with the story, you would get killed...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: So here you are, a wandering soul in the Ether that left his body on Earth.... body which by the way was an agape for the abominable mold monsters that appeared after the gamma wave hit your house...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Oh those mofos, next time I'll beat their asses!

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: You better get the vacuum cleaner more often next time.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I would get have killed by the gamma rays anyways.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: This we'll never know. You just were unconscious, you may had been lucky to wake up after a few minutes... but as the wave hit your home those mold monsters emerged from under your desk, and they were reallly hungry...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Oh, no, don't give more details! So now what? how I come back to my home?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Your home? you mean that mass of splinter, concrete and steel that now lies at the bottom of a big crater?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Oh no! what you were telling wasn´t a lie...  I didn´t believe you. Anyways the mobile evil crop story was incredible... some of those guys should be taken to court and pay the indie guys they ripped off!

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Some of them did, so I guess they repaired their sins somehow... also, think that they are feeding many families nowadays... it would be a catastrophe if we have more layoffs. The guys working at this big companies are genuinely in love with games, at least a great percentage of them...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Well, maybe, I don't know, the balck suits are still cowmilking some good people. ... anyways, what we do now?! how I can come back to Earth? oh my parents! what they will think when they go back home...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: And Kitty! where is my Kitty? noooooo. Did my cat die?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: No, she's fine... there's something I didn't tell you. Even that I'm an hologram, I can move some objects whose weight is less than 10 kilograms...
And how you do that? Holograms can't physically interact with any object...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Well that's advanced technology. I said hologram just to simplify. The Developer has accessed to some CERN advancements related with quantumm physics...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Anyways, don't expect this game to turn now into a graphic adventure where you move the mouse around and combine objects to solve puzzle... there's no budget so we need to keep things really simple. If you want to play a graphic adventure you rather go and Play Return To Monkey Island. Move past the first chapter which is a bit dull and you'll discover a little gem!

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: So where did you put Kitty?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: With the taxi driver that was waiting for you. Fortunately he could escape the gamma wave that hit your house...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Do you have the taxi driver address?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: What will you do, present to their house like a ghost without a body?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: You can't get past the atmosphere without a new body to reclaim... and this can take years or centuries. Having a functional body is a luxury that you guys do not know how to appreciate... your body takes your soul around to manifest in your actions..

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Oh, no, again a pseudo religious Christian talk? you start to get boring... I just want to get my body back!

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Well, you can't get your body in the same form and shape... choose one and then you'll need to wait until that form and shape is compatible is about to get created on Earth...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: created on Earth?

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, when a newborn comes to life, he develops physically according to certain mould...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Will I become a mold monster now? I don't want to join their ranks!

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: No, no. I said mould, not mold. I'm referring to "a hollow container used to give shape to molten or hot liquid material when it cools and hardens." according to the Oxford Dictionary.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Ah, like a vessel...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Exactly like a vessel. This vessel is defined in the father and mother genes... so nature knows what the soul chose and thus squashes it into the new body...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: There is an issue though... once you get into the body form, you'll forget everything of your past life...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Fantastic! so I won't remember who my fathers and Kitty are...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Of course you'll have new fathers... though your old fathers

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: No home, remember. Just a big meatball of concrete and iron in a hollow crater....

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: For real? so you can bring Kitty here with us in the skies? Pleease.

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Oh. I have something that gets rollled in my bedroom desk, first drawer. In a pencil case. Inside a plastic bag. Inside aluminium foil. Inside a condom with coffeee powder. One never knows when will need to take a flight. Maybe you can get your ass into that crater and retrieve it. Puffing while suspended in the stars must be a glorious experience!

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: Games on Steam can't promote drugs in any way or form. Do you want us to get sued? You would put the developer in a very miserable situation. Don't do that if you want a second part...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: I was just a puff... while you played Everbody's free from Rozalla. Besides, in some states is legal to smoke. Not only recreational, but for medical purposes...

Fields.Title: New Dialogue
Fields.Dialogue Text: But the more the smoke, the more memory you lose...

Fields.Title: Ether Limbo after getting killed, 1st Time
Fields.Description: Each time the Player gets killed, he'll appear in the Ether Limbo. He has a certain number of lives before the game is not playable anymore.
